messages.content: TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad fixes the issue of two-finger gesture support for macOS in ComfyUI.
What gestures are supported by TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad?
TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad supports two-finger scrolling (vertical and horizontal) to pan the canvas, two-finger pinch to zoom in and out, and command-scroll up and down to zoom in and out.
To install TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad, put the folder into ComfyUI/custom_nodes/TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad, restart ComfyUI, and reload the UI.
What is the purpose of TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad?
The purpose of TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad is to add two-finger gesture support for macOS in ComfyUI.
Where should you place the TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad folder during installation?
During installation, the TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad folder should be placed in ComfyUI/custom_nodes/TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad.
What should you do after placing the TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad folder in the correct location?
After placing the TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad folder in the correct location, you should restart ComfyUI and reload the UI.
What is the result of installing TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad?
After installing TinkerBot-tech-for-ComfyUI-Touchpad, you can enjoy two-finger gesture support for macOS in ComfyUI.
